body: Test cases look good. Need manual tests.

Could you support this in v5? @hanahmily 

@akozichev Is v6 working for you?  There is only direct link and k8s cluster management there. Of course, you have to build from tag, Apache release is under voting.

Coverage increased (+0.4%) to 12.652% when pulling **d1c42a80f7e70b372e8fe1ef548d55dc938d1f97 on sw6-header** into **6dd98b37bf7046c9445983fff8cc4403446d9e1b on master**.

After I read this plugin. I found that the root cause of this issue is that this plugin does not take into account the situation of call `reset` method. I think that we just intercept `reset` method and reset the `SWHystrixPluginsWrapperCache` object will be ok. Here is the pseudo code of the new interceptor:
```java
((EnhancedInstance)(HystrixPlugins.getInstance())).setSkyWalkingDynamicField(null);
```

@ascrutae I also thought about this, but there is a problem:

If Custom[SW[Default]] reset and register itself, then we clear the cache, next time the interceptor will wrap it again, the wrapper will become SW[Custom[SW[Default]]].
Ha, that really tricky scenario. But make sense.

it seems this issue also exists due to https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/pull/1682/commits/2f5f88c81713edc9e1760669496cf2057f64bd13 ,
why ·only enhancing  declared method` finally removed? @wu-sheng
See #1740 I think thay should fix this, could you confirm?

Why would there be  `Custom[SW[Default]]`  situation? What I understand is that Hystrix only set the one HystrixConcurrencyStrategy, and that is means the `registerConcurrencyStrategy` method executes before the `getConcurrencyStrategy` method or it will use the [default strategy](https://github.com/Netflix/Hystrix/blob/master/hystrix-core/src/main/java/com/netflix/hystrix/strategy/HystrixPlugins.java#L165)，so  `HystrixPluginsInterceptor` wrap the return value of `getConcurrencyStrategy` method and it will get the right way.

The Hystrix get `HystrixConcurrencyStrategy` by `getConcurrencyStrategy` method and clear `HystrixConcurrencyStrategy` by `reset` method, so Hystrix clear, we clear and Hystrix get, we put or get.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/20002463/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/20002463)

Coverage increased (+0.003%) to 12.26% when pulling **d6f16693c6f963fb27a7acb02a0cd10ab73f0e0f on cluster-wrong-order** into **513c1b86c6d86b981bf9e5c09c0d041d6c2d624e on master**.
The problem seems to bind the ipv4 interface to a static address. I suggest you change `ui.jetty.host` to `0.0.0.0`, which is suitable for collectors that do not know an ip address.
i think @ScienJus means, if get enhanced strategy and set it back

@ascrutae @wu-sheng yes, for example in [SleuthHystrixConcurrencyStrategy](https://github.com/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-sleuth/blob/99d38afc6993685653c102216f964fa1dec8c95d/spring-cloud-sleuth-core/src/main/java/org/springframework/cloud/sleuth/instrument/hystrix/SleuthHystrixConcurrencyStrategy.java#L66) , `this.delegate` will be `SW[Default]`, because it will trigger the `HystrixConcurrencyStrategyInterceptor `
by `getConcurrencyStrategy`, so it will register `Sleuth[SW[Default]]` as itself.

Coverage increased (+0.1%) to 12.745% when pulling **198b0bb813ede3f4675eff22fbd1ff961c09f71b on ScienJus:fix-hystrix-plugin** into **645a9a579d2f5f57714eafd808228591bd9d9d66 on apache:master**.

I have discussed with Xin. My question is, could your solution fix this? And how.

If not, I and Xin have a proposal, which is dofields scan for every strategy object. If skywalking wrapper found there, assume no need to do more. What do you think?

This solution is not perfect, but should good enough.

> My question is, could your solution fix this? And how.

My solution based on every HystrixConcurrencyStrategy implements a delegate pattern. If one of them does not, the SWHystrixConcurrencyStrategyWrapper will be lost. Just like if someone doesn't follow this plan, spring cloud slueth will also fail.

> which is dofields scan for every strategy object. If skywalking wrapper found there, assume no need to do more. What do you think?

Like the second option I said:

> If we don't trust the delegate pattern and must make
the SWHystrixConcurrencyStrategy exists in the delegate chain, it will be difficult, not only to intercept get/reset/register, but also there is no good way to confirm if a class is already on a delegate chain.

It will increase the complexity and still can not cover all situations (if the delegate is a List or another wrapper class does not explicitly extend HystrixConcurrencyStrategy ?).

I prefer to follow the existing conventions (how spring cloud does it), and I think if users use custom HystrixConcurrencyStrategy, they should already understand this convention and follow it. 

The decision is up to you, thanks.
To be specific, my question is about the scenario you bring up, if the get a strategy already wrappered, wrap it, then put back. You will still get double wrappers, right?
Just like you show up in Spring example. Why your option 1 could avoid?
in #1901. Just because it is only executed for the first time.
I think I finally got your whole point. I am ok with your pr, now.
Please submit new test cases, as we discussed.

@hanahmily  the unknown.png error is always existed while the 'drawimage' error happened occasionally. that's why i said unknown.png error is not the root cause   @wu-sheng i will try 6.0.0 UI and update the result then.
Thanks. We have fixed this in 6

hi sheng, i am using skywalking on our prod env, so it's not easy to upgrade to 6.0.0. now i am using a workaround to return empty string to avoid this error.but it's not a thorough way. 
i doubt whether it is cause by one application has mulitiple instances(i didn't meet this issue in our test env. in our test env, one application only has one instance, while on prod env, one application has more than one instance). it's not caused by some null field in es. sometimes in the same time bucket, we get source and target appids from application_reference_metric, but some source or target ids are not found in application_component. some data is missing which cause the error. i didn't find any suspicious errors in colloect or es. i am learning the collector code, not found the reason yet. any clues on it?

If your system is low throughputs, maybe. Ni component found in that duration. SkyWalking 6 uses the assumption that component not chang, until new one coming, also support no component app, based on istio metric, we don't know component.

@candyleer Thank for diving deep in this PR. My question is only about, your former PR looks like breaking our existing test cases. Could you verify what is happening?

From your demo codes, I could see enhanced declared methods only is a better way, @ni-ze used to send a pull request like this, but trigger a lot of test cases failure. Maybe you have time to verify and review the PR, instead of me?

I think this is the most important agent bug fix in this whole year, we need to be carefully of this. Maybe enhanced declared methods only make old bugs show up, but we need to fix that in a PR to make sure everything ready for end users.

I tried to set 0.0.0.0. But when I do it the Webapp fails to connect to collector, it looks like Collector's Nameserver  returns 0.0.0.0:12800 for Webapp to connect, which doesn't work. 
I couldn't find a way to connect Webapp to Collector "direct" bypassing the nameserver.
Perhaps v6 will work for me if it doesn't have same  issue, I haven't tried it yet.
V6 supported webhook now. You could send mail by your own.

This problem can be solved by slf4j `MDC` mechanism， `put and get method`like a `threadlocal map`, in async or sync log env, they have their own logic to guarantee `MDC.get(key)` can get the right value.
Ok,No problem
You may need to update the License file when you change the third party dependencies version.
Agree. Keep license file versions right as much as possible.

@wu-sheng @acurtain 

Today we found another issue about Hystrix in Spring Cloud 2, it is not a skywalking bug but can also be shared with you for reference.

https://github.com/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-netflix/issues/3256

Spring bean injection breaks the delegate chain and causes other HystrixConcurrencyStrategy(like SWHystrixConcurrencyStrategy) to be lost.
@ScienJus We should start another issue to track this. I am going to merge #1901
Spring Cloud 2 is not supported by now, I think. Should have multiple issues about that. @ScienJus Would you try to lead that? I am glad to help.
You break the CI, you must make sure CI is still working.

That depends, I don't know it is a bug or not yet. Haven't received any report about this before. But in theory, it could be less than 500. Traces are collected in your process by agent and transport by network, also with backend analysis, for keeping your application safe, we set a lot of mechanism to ignore traces if your backend, network and agent-side cpu are overloads.

You need to figure out, first thing, does the trace data support your 500cpm? 
Seconds, do you give the same(500cpm) payloads in your query duration? Also, check the trend graph, it should show you cpm in each minutes, which should verify this.

Here my collector `config/application.yml`:
```yaml
ui:
  jetty:
    # Stay in `localhost` if UI starts up in default mode.
    # Change it to OS real network IP(binding required), if deploy collector in different machine.
    host: 0.0.0.0
    port: 12800
    contextPath: /
```

and UI `webapp/webapp.yml`
```yaml
collector:
  path: /graphql
  ribbon:
    ReadTimeout: 10000
    listOfServers: collector-svc:12800
```
then map the ip of collectors/loadbalancer to the `collector-svc` domain name.

Do you have enough traces? I have commented this before. https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/issues/1908#issuecomment-438867830 

Another reason is, may some plugins are not compatible. But anyway, you need to know what is happening. 

Or you could try 6.0.0-alpha, to see is that right?
@wu-sheng We don't need to track it because this is a spring cloud bug, I just show you some bad design like this :)
Oh, interesting. Thank for bringing this to the community.

Webapp has authors mechanism.  If you want to use curl to do query. Try collector's ui IP and port. Graphql query is available there.

> 
> This line of code mean that we only enhance the method declered by current class？
> what if I send a request to the subclass controller, but the request method in superclass.

in this situation,will work as spring originally definition, for example:
` Mapped "{[/child/a]}" onto public java.lang.String com.example.test.ParentController.a(java.lang.Integer)`
will call superclass's method
